member.name: T:MelloShell.Commands.Cd
member.summary:
Navigates to a directory. Supplying no directory outputs nothing.
Usage: cd [options] [directory]
Options: -h, --h, --help: Prints this help text
Example:
Navigates to the "testdir/ directory.
cd testdir

member.name: T:MelloShell.Commands.Clear
member.summary:
Clears the terminal.
Usage: clear [options]
Options:
-h, --h, --help: Prints this help text
Example:
Clears terminal so that only the prompt remains...pretty self explanitory.
clear

member.name: T:MelloShell.Commands.CopyFile
member.summary:
Copies a file or multiple files to a directory.
Currently doesnt support copying directories. Usage: cp [options] [source] [dest]
Options:
-h, --h, --help: Prints this help text
-d: allows copying of directories
-p: prompts before overwriting
Example:
Copies the file "testfile1" to the "testdir" directory.
cp testfile1 testdir

member.name: T:MelloShell.Commands.CreateFile
member.summary:
Creates files or changes files access time.
Usage: touch [options] [filename(s)]
Options:
-h, --h, --help: Prints this help text
Example:
Creates a file named "testfile1".
touch tesfile1

member.name: T:MelloShell.Commands.Echo
member.summary:
Prints input to the console.
Usage: echo [options] [string]
Options:
-h, --h, --help: Prints this help text
Example:
Outputs "Hello World!" to the console.
echo Hello World!

member.name: T:MelloShell.Commands.Ls
member.summary:
Lists the directories and files of a directory and its information. No input prints from the current directory.
Usage: ls [options] [directory(s)]
Options:
-h, --h, --help: Prints this help text
-l: Prints this help text
-a: Include hidden directories
Example:
Prints the files of the "testdir" directory
ls testdir

member.name: T:MelloShell.Commands.MakeDirectory
member.summary:
Creates directories
Usage: mkdir [options] [dirname(s)]
Options:
-h, --h, --help: Prints this help text
Example:
Creates directory "testdir1" and "testdir2" in the current directory.
mkdir testdir1 testdir2

member.name: T:MelloShell.Commands.MoveFile
member.summary:
Moves files or directories to another directory.
Does not support renaming files or directories. See rename. Usage: mv [options] [source name] [dest name]
Options:
-h, --h, --help: Prints this help text
Example:
Moves the file "testfile1" to the directory "testdir2"
mv testfile1 testdir2

member.name: T:MelloShell.Commands.RemoveDirectory
member.summary:
Deletes directories.
Usage: rmdir [options] [directory(s)]
Options:
-h, --h, --help: Prints this help text
Example:
Deletes directory "testdir2" in "testdir". "testdir" does not get removed.
rmdir testdir/testdir2

member.name: T:MelloShell.Commands.RemoveFile
member.summary:
Deletes files.
Usage: rm [options] [file(s)]
Options:
-h, --h, --help: Prints this help text
Example:
Deletes the files "testfile1" and "testfile2" in the current directory.
rm testfile1 testfile2

member.name: T:MelloShell.Commands.RenameFile
member.summary:
Renames files.
Currently doesnt support renaming directories. Usage: rename [options] [source] [suggested name]
Options:
-h, --h, --help: Prints this help text
Example:
Renames file "foo" to "bar".
rename foo bar

member.name: T:MelloShell.Commands.RunProgram
member.summary:
Runs a program.
Command is a work in progress. Usage: run [options] [program]
Options:
-h, --h, --help: Prints this help text
Example:
Runs the exe "somescript".
run somescript.exe
